fact_check_explanation_title: What does the new lockdown mean for childcare in England?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Our readers have asked us how the new lockdown rules affect childcare.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fact-checking claims on coronavirus transmission in schools
fact_check_explanation_summary: Our readers have asked us to look into claims made by the NEU and Skwawkbox about Covid-19 transmission in schools.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Covid-19 vaccine is not being administered via Covid-19 nasal swab tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: Despite the fact that some other animal vaccines are administered via the nose, the Covid-19 swab test is not a Covid-19 vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: “Article 61” of Magna Carta doesn’t allow you to ignore Covid-19 regulations
fact_check_explanation_summary: Clause 61 of the original document set out rules for specific barons. The clause was removed after a year.

fact_check_explanation_title: BBC presenters did remove their poppies as they were wearing them earlier than BBC guidelines allow
fact_check_explanation_summary: BBC guidelines state poppies can be worn from 6am on 31 October.

fact_check_explanation_title: Daily Mirror misrepresents research on public support for Brexit
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Daily Mirror claimed a new poll shows that 62% think Britain was wrong to leave the EU.

fact_check_explanation_title: A comparison of daily deaths from Covid-19 and non-Covid causes is incorrect
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Covid-19 figures are incorrect based on when the claim was made, and we don’t have recent figures for the non-Covid deaths.

fact_check_explanation_title: £24,000 doesn’t represent what most Universal Credit claimants receive
fact_check_explanation_summary: Lee Anderson MP used the figure to argue against all Universal Credit claimants being entitled to free school meals.

fact_check_explanation_title: No, we are not on track for a normal number of deaths this year
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook compares the death toll this year in England in Wales with the UK death toll in previous years to incorrectly suggest we are on course for …

fact_check_explanation_title: The WHO has not decided attending school implies consent for vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: In the UK you can’t be forced to have a vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Soy sauce imports from Japan will not be cheaper next year
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK already imports soy sauce from Japan tariff-free under the EU-Japan deal.

fact_check_explanation_title: The number of doctors working for the NHS in England has increased in the past year
fact_check_explanation_summary: Even when excluding final year students fast tracked into hospital roles due to the pandemic, the number of doctors has risen.
